208
HEREDITARY STATEMENT
(1) If an heir accepts or renounces his or her inheritance, he or she has to sign a statement to this effect, or it shall be signed by his or her representative.
(2) The signature on the statement of the acceptance or renunciation of the inheritance submitted to the court does not have to be certified; when in doubt, the court may request the certification of a written statement on the renunciation of an inheritance or the power of attorney.
(3) In the statement, it shall be stated whether the heir accepts or renounces the portion he or she is entitled to either by an Act or by a will, or whether the statement relates to a statutory portion.
(4) The heir may make a statement on the renunciation of his or her inheritance at the probate court or any other court with subject-matter jurisdiction accorded by an Act.
(5) When an heir is making a statement on the renunciation of his or her inheritance, the court shall warn him or her that he or she may renounce his or her inheritance only on his or her own behalf or on behalf of his or her descendants.
